III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
Section (1) The licensee shall develop and adhere to a written staff-to-
Description resident ratio formula for direct care workers.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
1

Allegation Youth goes into the room of another youth at the facility to touch
youth sexually. This has happened every night since youth was
placed in the shelter on 7/7/2023.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant/Supervisor 1
Complainant is a supervisor at Wolverine Center. I interviewed
Supervisor 1 on 01/05/2024 at Wolverine Center with another
Department of Health and Human Service Worker. Supervisor 1
stated Youth A did not want to return to his room on 12/29/2023
and alleged Youth B entered his room every night and touched
him inappropriately. Supervisor 1 stated there are no reports of
Youth B entering Youth A’s room. Supervisor 1 stated each youth
at Wolverine Center has his own room. Supervisor 1 stated Youth
B is on a one staff to one youth ratio during waking and sleeping
hours. Supervisor 1 stated Youth B’s one staff to one youth staff
person sits directly in front of Youth B’s door during sleeping hours
and at least one other staff person is present on the floor to
monitor the other youths.
Youth A
I interviewed Youth A on 01/05/2024 at Wolverine Center with
another Department of Health and Human Service Worker. Youth
A started the interview by stating he did not want to be
interviewed. Youth A stated he does not feel safe at Wolverine
Center because a youth can enter another youth’s room and
break things. Youth A stated the youth rooms do not have locks.
Youth A stated Youth B threatened him and stated he did not want
to be interviewed. Youth A stated he knows about inappropriate
touches and does not want to talk about it. Youth A stated the
inappropriate touching incident did not occur at Wolverine Center
and was already investigated.
Youth B
I interviewed Youth B on 01/05/2024 at Wolverine Center with
another Department of Health and Human Service Worker. Youth
B explained Wolverine Center’s bedtime routine. Youth B stated
the television is turned off at 9:00 PM and youths are in their
rooms by 10:00 PM. Youth B stated he lays down on his bed, but
does not fall asleep right away and may be up until 1:30 AM.
Youth B stated a staff person sits outside his room door and
another staff person checks on the other youths at least every 15
minutes. Youth B was asked if he left his room at night. Youth B
stated he does not leave his room at night because there is
nothing to do. Youth B stated sometimes he gets out of bed and
2

talks with staff. Youth B stated youths are not permitted to go in to
each other’s room. Youth B stated his room was recently moved
to the third floor, but he resided by Youth A, Youth C, and Youth
D’s room when he was on the second floor.
Youth C
I interviewed Youth C on 01/18/2024 at Wolverine Center with
another Department of Health and Human Service Worker. Youth
C stated he had a room by Youth A and Youth B on the second
floor. Youth C stated Youth B has his own staff person because
he is on a one staff to one youth ratio. Youth C stated there is at
least one other staff person in the hallway monitoring the other
youths during sleeping hours and staff check on the youths about
every 15 minutes. Youth C stated Youth B walked in to his room
once and staff (does not recall who) redirected Youth B to leave
his room because youths are not permitted to be in another
youth’s room. Youth C stated he does not have concerns or know
of concerns about bullying or boundaries at Wolverine Center.
Youth D
I interviewed Youth D on 01/18/2024 at Wolverine Center with
another Department of Health and Human Service Worker. Youth
D stated he had a room by Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C on the
second floor. Youth D stated there is two to three staff persons on
duty at night and staff complete room checks. Youth D stated
Youth B has his own staff person because he is on a one staff to
one youth ratio. Youth D stated Youth B never went in to other
youth’s room because it is not permitted. Youth D stated no one
would go in to Youth A’s room because Youth A urinates on
himself and the room smells. Youth D stated the younger youths
in general fear Youth B.
Staff Person 1
I interviewed Staff Person 1 on 01/18/2024 at Wolverine Center
with another Department of Health and Human Service Worker.
Staff Person 1 stated Youth A and Youth B do not get along. Staff
Person 1 stated Youth B is on a one staff to one youth ratio and a
staff person sits directly outside of Youth B’s room door each
night. Staff Person 1 stated at least one other staff person is
assigned to the floor to monitor and check on the other youths at
night. Staff Person 1 is unaware of an incident about Youth B
entering another youth’s room at night.
Staff Person 2
I interviewed Staff Person2 on 01/18/2024 at Wolverine Center
with another Department of Health and Human Service Worker.
3

Staff Person 2 stated Youth B is on a one staff to one youth ratio
for all shifts. Staff Person 2 stated he worked midnight shifts
assigned to Youth B. Staff Person 2 stated Youth B never came
out of his room and entered another youth’s room. Staff Person 2
stated a staff person sits directly in front of Youth B’s room during
sleeping hours and another staff person is also in the hallway
monitoring and checking on the other youths.
Video
Random sleeping hour video footages were reviewed.
12/26/2023 9:00 PM to 9:30 PM shows Youth B in the game room
with his one staff to one youth staff person. No other youths are in
the game room.
12/27/2023 11:30 PM to 12:00 AM shows a staff person sitting in
front of Youth B’s doorway. Another staff person is positioned at a
desk with view to the hallway directly in front and to the right and
left. No youth activity is seen.
12/27/2023 1:00 AM to 1:30 AM shows a staff person sitting in
front of Youth B’s doorway. Another staff person is positioned at a
desk with view to the hallway directly in front and to the right and
left. No youth activity is seen.
12/28/2023 9:30 PM to 10:00 PM shows a staff person sitting in
front of Youth B’s doorway. Two other staff are seen in the
hallways. No youth activity is seen.
12/28/2023 12:00 AM to 12:30 AM shows a staff person sitting in
front of Youth B’s doorway. Another staff person is positioned at a
desk with view to the hallway directly in front and to the right and
left. No youth activity is seen.
12/28/2023 1:00 AM to 1:30 AM shows Youth B stands in his
doorway and his one staff to one youth staff person is also
standing. They walk and talk to a staff person in the hallway
before returning to Youth B’s room. A supervisor and another staff
person are seen. No other youth activity is seen.
Documentation
Incident reports
• There are no incident reports about Youth A and Youth B.
Youth B staffing
4

• Youth B was placed on two staff to one youth ratio on
12/06/2023 and changed to one staff to one youth ratio on
12/11/2023 for property destruction, sexualized behavior,
physical aggression, and history of truancy per Chief
Administrator.
Youth A room assignment
• Youth A ‘s room was moved from the second floor to the
third floor on 12/29/2023 per Chief Administrator.
Tour
One enters the second floor and steps in to a hallway. There is a
television room immediately to the left and a common room to the
left in the middle of the hallway. Youth rooms are on both sides of
the hallway. A perpendicular hallway is at the end of this hallway.
The youth bathroom is at this meeting point. Youth rooms are to
the right and to the left in this hallway. (Youth rooms are not all
occupied.)
Another Department of Health and Human Service Agency
completed an investigation without finding.
Analysis Interviews and video review do not find Youth B entered Youth A’s
room at night. This investigation will be reopened if additional
information becomes available.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
5

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
